title: 10 activities on offer today
text:
10 activities on offer today 1st Oct 2015 7:41 AM ON A ROLL: During the school holidays, Caloundra Rollerdrome day sessions from Monday to Sunday are 10am-noon and 2pm-4pm. Warren Lynam Cars For Sale 
1. Pierre's Kitchen Capers 
JOIN French Chef Pierre at The Ginger Factory for free school holiday entertainment. Prepare for a side-splitting morning as Chef Pierre entertains the family with all kinds of hilarious kitchen capers, creating mischief and mayhem in his crazy Parisian kitchen. 
When: Until tomorrow 
Where: The Ginger Factory, 50 Pioneer Rd, Yandina. 
Cost: Free 
CREATE cute bendy paper puppets. Activity suitable for ages eight and up. 
Where: Kawana Library 

3. Music Mayhem 
JOIN Katie-Anne at the Maroochy Botanic Garden to discover and explore the garden's "forests song" then create your very own musical instruments using natural and recycled materials. 
Where: Maroochy Botanic Garden, Palm Creek Rd, Tanawha 
When: Today 12.30-2pm (4+ years) 
Cost: $7.50 

4. Floating Land 
THERE will be many fun and creative things to see and do at Floating Land at Boreen Point including an artist studio trail, Jazz Trio Dawn Concert, foreshore artworks, twilight markets, Heart of Gold films, and Apollonian Jam Sessions 
Where: Boreen Point 
When: Tomorrow to Monday - sunrise, sunset and in-between 
Cost: Free 

5. Spring Art Spectacular 
BLACKALL Range Visual Artists are holding a Spring Art Spectacular until Monday at St.Mary's Hall in Montville. All commissions are donated to the upkeep of St Mary's Hall. 
Where: St Mary's Hall in Montville 
When: Open 10am to 4pm daily 
Cost: Free 

6. Charm Of Finches 
THIS will be a one-off today with beautiful music and a casual organic dinner. Go along and support two young artists from Melbourne on their way to open for Kasey Chambers at the Murwillumbah Country Roots Fest. 
Where: Sunspace Cafe, 6 Beddington Rd, Doonan 
When: Today 5-6.30pm 

7. Roller skating 
WHETHER you're an accomplished skater or a first-timer, Caloundra Rollerdrome will get you rolling into fun times. 
Where: Caloundra Rollerdrome, 19 Caloundra Rd 
When: Day sessions Monday to Sunday during school holidays are 10am-noon and 2pm-4pm. 
Cost: $12 plus $5 skate/blade hire. 
Info: 5491 4255. www.rollerdrome. com.au6. 

8. SEA LIFE Mooloolaba 
LEGO City Deep Sea Experience is an exciting offering, complementing SEA LIFE's regular activity schedule featuring daily talks, animal feeds and presentations, and special holiday programs. 
Where: SEA LIFE Mooloolaba, Parkyn Pde 
When: Open from 9am daily 
Info: http://www.underwaterworld.com.au. 
Book tickets online and save up to 20%. Adult from $39, children (3-14) from $26, concession from $30 and a family (two adults, two children) from $110. 

9. BATS Theatre 
BATS Theatre Company at Buderim presents Agatha Christie's classic, And Then There Were None, designed to thrill and treat the audience with an evening or afternoon of mystery and comedy. 
Where: Buderim War Memorial Hall, cnr Main and Church Sts. 
When: Evening: October 2, 3, 9 and 10 at 7.30pm. Matinees: October 4 and 10 at 2pm. 
Cost: Adults $20, concession $18, members/uni students $16, school students $14. Tables of eight so get a table of friends together or just book and share a table. BYO drinks and nibbles. 
Bookings: http://www.batstheatre.com or phone 5445 25158. 

10. Namba Now! Live After Five 
C-SQUARE presents an exciting line-up of live original music by Karen Law Band, Liam James Campbell and Bub-Kiss. The Loose Kaboose train tram is back for the little ones. Showcase returns with a boutique suitcase market presented by The Bison Bar. Food carts include ii-Naa Japanese, Pops Hangi, The Bali Cart and Sweet Floz Churros. Artists in residence at Gallery Loloma. Late night shopping at Seek & Find (for lovers of Vintage). 
Where: C-Square Courtyard, Nambour Civic Centre 
When: Tomorrow 5.30pm-8.30pm
